column4: i am not the owner, so i can not change these permissions, that's what it says when i try to delete a certain file.  i i am the root user, but why can't i delete it still? is ther a way??
the root account is disabled by default in ubuntu. The first user is not a root user, however you can prefix commands with "sudo" to give it root privileges
prefix the command with "sudo", so for example "sudo gedit foo" or "sudo rm foo"
The command you were attempting earlier, put a sudo before it. My examples were just examples... you weren't meant to do them
the page is still blank
What were you trying to do originally?
originally i was trying to install a korean version of firefox
then there was an error in installing, and now my english firefox is broken also
that's what it says when i try to delete a certain file. is what the original problem was... Hmm... I'm not too sure about what you're trying to do now...
i'm trying to get rid of something called "lock", because it seems that it's preventing me from uninstalling (or reinstalling)the bad firefox file
How did you install this "bad firefox"?
synaptic package
So why wouldn't synaptic remove it?
what's the name of the package?
mozilla-firefox-locale-ko
sudo apt-get -f install Will fix things I think...
ok will try..
close synaptic or any other package managers then try again
it says :  E:  unmet dependencies.  Try 'apt-get -f install; with no packages (or specify a solution).
sudo apt-get remove mozilla-firefox-locale-ko ?
sudo is a security feature. root is disabled in ubuntu as a security feature.
anyone/any guide that tells you to use a root session instead of sudo is wrong or broken.
